channel.title: EDIT: Change of question. How do you open a file on program start in Delphi...?
channel.description:
Ok change of question :rolleyes:
When you, for example, double click a text file, notepad opens with it already loaded. However, I'm making a text editor in Delphi (for experience), and when I open a file with it, all it does it run the program. No file loads. How can I make it load a file when it starts like that?

item.title: EDIT: Change of question. How do you open a file on program start in Delphi...?
item.dc:creator: @Nwfd1025 Nwfd1025
item.description:
@Nwfd1025 wrote:

if it doesnt work come abck and ask more

Read full topic
item.source: EDIT: Change of question. How do you open a file on program start in Delphi...?

item.title: EDIT: Change of question. How do you open a file on program start in Delphi...?
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

I’m assuming you mean that you want your text editor application to open txt files. When you set the application to open the file with, be sure to include the filename as a parameter (I believe in the registry you can simply add “%1”…not positive though don’t have access on this comp to check right now). Then Modify your application to read command-line parameters and get it to load the file with that path at run

Read full topic
item.source: EDIT: Change of question. How do you open a file on program start in Delphi...?

item.title: EDIT: Change of question. How do you open a file on program start in Delphi...?
item.dc:creator: @bullzeye95 bullzeye
item.description:
@bullzeye95 wrote:

Lol no that’s not it. I mean like you double click on a text file and notepad opens with it already loaded.[br][size=1]Posted on: February 26, 2007, 09:09:21 PM[/size][hr]OK, I rephrased the question

Read full topic
item.source: EDIT: Change of question. How do you open a file on program start in Delphi...?

item.title: EDIT: Change of question. How do you open a file on program start in Delphi...?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

bullzeye:

I know how to do that (if I know what you mean), but if I try to open a file with my program, it just starts up with a blank document.

Are you sure your using your dialogs right? So when you load the file in the dialog and click open, the memo(or richedit or whatever your using) text is set to load from the file chosen on the dialog? Try searching google to learn how to make a text editor in Delphi. It should tell you how to do all of this.

Read full topic

item.title: EDIT: Change of question. How do you open a file on program start in Delphi...?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Ok. You need to edit the registry for a .txt file to say open with a specific program you want. If you don’t know how to do it then do some googling.

Read full topic
